instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01949-A Water damage
threads.message:
I have a water damage 820-01949-A logicboard. it had damage on the U3100_x area. I replaced R3070, R3058, R3057, R3072, R3033, and C3101_x
when I connect a charger I get 20V and it goes up to 0.79A then the Apple logo comes on but it'll be stuck on the logo and goes down to 0.40A, 0.30A, and A jumps up and down. Also, I noticed the D3100_x is damaged as well but I can't find D3100_X(NSR20F40NX_G) online to replace it. Would it be alright if I take it off and test the board or any advice on where I should look for?

[ATTACH type="full"]60395[/ATTACH]

threads.title: 820-01949-A Water damage
threads.message:
Board works without D3100.
However, no more protection agains charger spikes.

Machine remains with Apple logo, or turns off/restart?
As always for T2 machines, try DFU...

threads.title: 820-01949-A Water damage
threads.message: It stays on the Apple logo then fans kicks in at high speed.

threads.title: 820-01949-A Water damage
threads.message:
can't put it on DFU mode. when I connect a USB C. it won't take more than 5V & 0A. Any advice?

when the charger is connected

when the charger and a USB C are connected

threads.title: 820-01949-A Water damage
threads.message:
Did you follow all the steps from DFU tutrial linked on the forum?
You can try to force DFU; using RE032 pads.
